narrative.title: 4Th Indian Division - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division (Indian Army) deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.temperature: 15-30°C (April-June 1943). Spring conditions, cooler than summer desert. Mountain areas cooler, coastal areas warmer.
weather.environmental_challenges: Mountain warfare primary challenge - steep terrain, narrow passes, limited vehicle mobility. Division's training and doctrine well-suited to mountainous country. Mine clearance difficult in rocky terrain. Some malaria risk in coastal/agricultural areas. Better water availability than Western Desert reduced heat casualties.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter
